author: Alberta Cobb
title: Who are dark gods?
text:
Who are dark gods?
Dark gods are primordial deities, or Ae’ada, of incredible power who gave up their divinity and virtues to embrace darkness and malevolence. They represent the source of all evil and foulness in Creation.
What does dark god mean?
Dark god refers to a primordial deity or Ae’ada who has chosen to abandon their divine nature and embrace darkness and malevolence. These gods are often associated with evil and represent the source of all darkness and foulness in creation.
What refers to the Dark god?
The Dark god is typically referred to as Erebus in Greek mythology. Erebus is a primordial Greek god of darkness. He is also known as Erebos. Greek cosmology held Erebus to be a key figure in the origin story of the universe; he is the personification of the primordial darkness which preceded the earth, sky, and ocean.
Who is the god of death?
Hades, Pluto, and Hel are some of the most well-known gods of death and the underworld from ancient mythology. They hold dominion over the realm of the dead and are often associated with the afterlife. Nearly all ancient cultures have their own god or goddess of death.
Is there a god of night?
In Greek mythology, the goddess Nyx is often considered the personification of the night. She is the offspring of Chaos and the mother of Aether and Hemera (Day) by Erebus (Darkness). Nyx represents the mysterious and dark aspect of the night, and she holds dominion over it.
DC’s New Dark Gods Origins – A New Breed of Sick and Twisted Gods Who Can Defeat Likes of Darkseid
This question seems to refer to a specific storyline or comic series in the DC Universe. It explores the origins of the New Dark Gods, who are depicted as a powerful and twisted group of divine beings. They have the ability to challenge and potentially defeat powerful entities such as Darkseid.
Who is the darkest god?
In Greek mythology, Erebus is often considered the darkest god. He is a primordial deity associated with darkness and is believed to be the personification of the primordial darkness that existed before the creation of the earth, sky, and ocean.
Is there a god of Chaos?
In Greek mythology, there is a goddess named Chaos who is often considered the personification of primordial disorder and chaos. She is one of the first entities to exist in the universe and plays a foundational role in Greek cosmogony.
Who is the god of pain?
In Greek mythology, Algea, also known as the Algos, are the personification of pain. They represent both physical and mental anguish and are often associated with the suffering experienced by humans and gods alike.
Who is the most powerful god?
In different mythological traditions, there are various gods considered the most powerful. In Greek mythology, Zeus is often regarded as the most powerful god, wielding thunder and lightning. In Hindu mythology, Indra is considered supreme, followed by Agni, the fire god.
Who is the male god of love?
The male god of love varies depending on the mythological tradition. In Greek mythology, Eros, also known as Cupid in Roman mythology, is the male god of love. He is often portrayed as a young and handsome figure who wields a bow and arrows to make people fall in love.
Who is the shadow god?
In mythology and folklore, there are various deities or supernatural beings associated with shadows. One example is the Shadow God, a figure born from the entwining of light and darkness. The Shadow God is often depicted as having both a good side and a shadow side and is usually associated with the realm of shadows and darkness.
Who is the god of eternal darkness?
In the Dungeons & Dragons fantasy roleplaying game, Tharizdun is the god of Eternal Darkness, Decay, Entropy, Malign Knowledge, Insanity, and Cold. Tharizdun originated in the World of Greyhawk campaign setting and is often depicted as a powerful and sinister deity associated with darkness and destruction.
What is the divine dark?
The divine dark refers to the concept of a profound and mystical darkness that is associated with the divine essence and the core of all existence. It is not an ordinary darkness but a majestic and luminous blackness that represents the absolute essence of Being and the inner truth of true nature.
Is darkness evil in the Bible?
In the Bible, darkness is often used metaphorically to represent evil, sin, and spiritual ignorance. However, it is important to note that darkness itself is not inherently evil. In some verses, darkness is also associated with God’s presence and protection.
Who is the most powerful evil God?
In mythology and folklore, there are various gods or divine beings associated with evil. One example is the Mesopotamian goddess-demoness Lamashtu, who is often regarded as the most powerful evil god or goddess. Lamashtu is associated with inflicting harm and misfortune, particularly to women and children.
Who is the most powerful God of death?
Various gods and goddesses are associated with death in different mythologies. In Greek mythology, Hades, Pluto, and Hel are among the most powerful gods of death and the underworld. They preside over the realm of the dead and hold dominion over the afterlife.
Who is the most powerful God of love?
Different mythologies have different gods associated with love. In Greek mythology, Aphrodite is often considered the most powerful goddess of love and beauty. She represents the force of love and desire. In Hindu mythology, Kamadeva is the god of love and desire, often depicted as a young and handsome figure wielding a bow and arrows.
Who is the god of terror?
In Greek mythology, Deimos and Phobos are the gods or personifications of fear and terror. Deimos represents terror and dread, while Phobos symbolizes panic, flight, and rout. They are often associated with war and are depicted as companions of Ares, the god of war.
Who is the god of insanity?
In Ancient Greek mythology, Maniae or Mania are the spirits personifying insanity, madness, and crazed frenzy. They are closely related to Lyssa, the spirit of rage and rabies, and are believed to be daughters of Nyx, the goddess of the night.
Who is the god of violent death?
In Greek mythology, the Keres were female death-spirits who personified violent death. They were drawn to bloody deaths on battlefields and were associated with the brutal and destructive

author: kj005
title: 当人工智能遇见千年文明--瞬息宇宙如何让50+国宝在2025WAIC现场重生?_中华网
text:
摘要：这次，瞬息宇宙把《女史箴图》 复刻 到了WAIC大会现场
2025年7月26日，全球人工智能领域的目光再次聚焦——2025世界人工智能大会（WAIC）正迎来最具想象力的科技与文化碰撞时刻。
当前，全球智能化浪潮风起云涌，人工智能领域创新呈群体 性 突破之势，语言大模型、多模态大模型和具身智能等领域日新月异，推动人工智能向更高效、强智能的方向快速发展。人工智能与实体经济深度融合的特征更加明显，已经开始赋能千行百业、走进千家万户，成为经济增长的新引擎，渗透到社会生活各方面。
作为本次大会“智能终端馆”与“核心技术馆”的双料核心参展商，S-instant瞬息宇宙以“技术+文化”双轮驱动，双展 台 震撼亮相，为全球观众呈现了一场跨越虚实的沉浸式盛宴，更以技术创新重新定义了“人工智能+文化传播”的新边界。
01 领导 莅临 指示 ：政企共探科技赋能新路径
7月27日下午，无锡市市委 书记 杜小刚带队赴上海，拜访2025世界人工智能大会参展企业，参观了智元机器人、瞬息宇宙等展区。杜小刚一行现场体验了瞬息宇宙全新首发的《 国家 宝藏》IP，双方就将AI+XR技术场景化输出至无锡梅里古镇、灵山胜境、拈花湾等景区进行了深入讨论。
02 《 国家 宝藏》IP 首秀，打造 长三角XR文旅新范式
此次WAIC大会《 国家 宝藏》IP首秀，用“五感联动”的多维度感官轰炸，打造沉浸新体验，彻底打破了传统文博展览的静态模式，全感XR沉浸式体验重构感官体验，引发用户关于“文明如何与未来对话”的深度思考，堪称文化遗产数字化觉醒的技术秀。
在守护国宝归家的沉浸体验中，战场硝 烟 与青铜器的味道随剧情推进动态释放，跨越千年文明史诗长廊，从商周青铜器、到唐宋笔墨书画、明清瓷器，可以一次 性 纵览50余件中华瑰宝，文化遗产从静态陈列走向动态传承，散落于全球的文明碎片在数字空间中重聚，尘封的历史记忆被一一唤醒……
0 3 双展 台 引爆WAIC，累计接待11000人，超1000人合作咨询
活动首日瞬息宇宙展 台 人流如织，开展即引爆WAIC，活动累计接待用户超11000人次，日均客流突破2750人，现场咨询合作人数超1000人，来自欧美、新加坡、马来西亚、泰国的合作方纷纷表现出强烈的合作意向。展 台 前排起蜿蜒长队，从入口一直延伸至馆内通道，宛如一条流动的星河。人群中响起此起彼伏的好评声，连地面都被脚步带起 微 微 的震颤。
如果说《 国家 宝藏》全感XR沉浸体验是用五感唤醒历史，那么瞬息宇宙与AI算力领军企业天罡智算联合展区的MR（混合现实）展 台 则用“虚实共生”刷新了观众对“空间”的认知。虚实融合的MR体验，以“科技轻量化”与“场景深度化”的双重突破，重新定义空间计算的实用边界。
瞬息宇宙此次双展 台 梦幻联动，强势破局，以虚实融合的场景重构文旅 元宇宙 的产业逻辑。不仅让观众触摸到文明的脉搏，更昭示着XR技术与文化融合的终极可能——当科技成为文明的“翻译器”，虚实边界便不再是桎梏，而是一个充满无限可能的起点。
04 战略 合作 达成 ：AI+行业激活产业升级新动能
借此WAIC大会，瞬息宇宙也与上海航空国际旅游（集团）有限公司、上海电影（集团）有限公司以及帛莱恩航空科技集团达成战略合作，聚焦“AI+行业”深度融合，通过人工智能技术与多领域产业的协同创新，激活传统产业升级新动能，为各行业智能化转型注入新活力。
1、 XR技术激活经典IP，打造“虚实共生”的影视新纪元
瞬息宇宙与上影制作将合作共建“ 元宇宙 XR全感影院”，双方将依托AI+XR技术，共同在上海影视乐园落位《瞬息魔方》沉浸式项目，对红色文旅、 国家 宝藏、丝绸之路、太空探索、经典国漫等不同热门主题IP进行数字化重生，开启“虚实共生”的影视创作新范式。此次合作不仅是传统文化IP的科技焕新，更是 中国 影视工业化4.0时代的 重要 里程碑。
2 、 AI+研学：重构教育新范式
瞬息宇宙与帛莱恩航空科技集团计划将围绕低空经济与XR虚拟飞行，依托帛莱恩丰富的航空科技资源与瞬息宇宙的数字技术优势，开发沉浸式研学课程，打造激发青少年航空科技兴趣的研学基地，推动科技教育与产业需求深度融合，助力航空科普与后备人才培养，为产教协同发展注入新活力。
0 5 未来已来 ，打造 虚实共生新纪元
瞬息宇宙在2025WAIC的精彩表现，不仅彰显了其在XR技术应用领域的领先地位，更为全球观众呈现了一场科技与文化的视听盛宴。通过双展 台 联动、新IP首发与跨界战略合作，瞬息宇宙正以开放创新的姿态，引领AI+XR技术向更广泛的领域渗透，为数字经济与文化传承注入强劲动力。未来，瞬息宇宙将继续深耕XR领域，探索科技边界，让“智能改变生活，文化连接世界”的愿景照进现实。
免责声明：市场有风险，选择需谨慎！此文仅供参考，不作买卖依据。
责任编辑：kj005 文章投诉热线:157 3889 8464 投诉邮箱:7983347 16@qq.com
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: kentlivenewsdesk@reachplc.com (Hedi Mehrez)
title: Live Southeastern updates as flooded tunnel causes severe delays
text: Southeastern services in Kent are being 'severely delayed' between Ebbsfleet and Stratford due to flooding in one of the tunnels under the Thames. The incident is causing signalling problem which means trains in both directions are forced to only use one line. Passengers can expect delays of up to 50 minutes, according to Southeastern Railway. People have been told to use alternative routes into London. A Southeastern spokesperson said: "Our highspeed services are being severely delayed between Ebbsfleet and Stratford and are likely to be altered at short notice which may include terminating at a station before their destination, or starting at an alternative station." READ MORE: [Kent weather: Met Office issues 16-hour wind warning for New Year weekend with 75mph gusts](https://www.kentlive.news/news/kent-news/kent-weather-met-office-issues-9003054) READ MORE: [Man who lives in his Ford Fiesta spends ‘perfect Christmas’ alone in Kent woods](https://www.kentlive.news/news/real-life/man-who-lives-ford-fiesta-9001236) Those travelling this afternoon (December 29) can use services from Charing Cross or London Bridge for trains between London and Gravesend, Ashford, Folkestone, Dover, Ramsgate and Canterbury West. Those at Canoon Street or London Bridge can take trains between London and Gravesend, Rochester, Chatham, Gillingham, Faversham, Margate and Ramsgate. Passengers can use their ticket to complete their journey at no extra cost on the London Underground, Thameslink, Elixabeth Line, Docklands Light Railway and Arriva Fastrack. Get more news from KentLive straight to your inbox for free [ HERE.](https://www.kentlive.news/newsletter-preference-centre/?view=Solus&mailingListId=96cee646-b697-4646-b9ab-9aa4e9bcf869&utm_source=solusarticle) Alternative services These are the alternative services affected passengers can use at no extra cost: - London Underground between London Bridge, London Cannon Street, Charing Cross, Stratford and London St Pancras International - Thameslink between London St Pancras International and Rainham - Elizabeth Line between Stratford and Central London - Docklands Light Railway between Stratford International and Central London - Arriva Fastrack route B between Ebbsfleet and Gravesend What we know so far Southeastern has released the following update and guidance for passenegers: What's happened? Flooding has occurred in one of the two railway tunnels near Ebbslfleet, meaning only one tunnel is open. This has reduced the capacity available to run trains. Disruption will continue until the end of service today. How does this affect my journey? There is a very limited service running between London St Pancras International and Ebbsfleet International. - Services between London St Pancras International and Faversham will not run between London St Pancras International and Ebbsfleet International - Services between London St Pancras International and Faversham will not run between London St Pancras International and Ebbsfleet International - Most services between London St Pancras International and Ramsgate via Dover will not run between London St Pancras International and Ebbsfleet International - consider alternatives routes What do I need to do? If you can, please use our alternative services from London Cannon Street & London Charing Cross: - Use LondonCharing Cross or London Bridge for trains between London and Gravesend, Ashford, Folkestone, Dover, Ramsgate and Canterbury West - Use London Cannon Street or London Bridge for trains between London and Gravesend, Rochester, Chatham, Gillingham, Faversham Margate and Ramsgate Information taken from Southeastern's website [here](https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/travel-information/live-travel-information/service-disruption?uq=6383946948897 #INC754C93D69F9746528562EFC5EB49D464) Video of flooded tunnel released Southeastern Railway has released video footage of the flooded tunnel, which is impacting train services. In a social media update, they say services continue to face disruption and there will be a 'very limited service to and from St Pancras International for the rest of the day.' You can watch the video [here](https://x.com/Se_Railway/status/1740770839681761685?s=20) Disruption until the end of the day Trains between St Pancras and Ebbsfleet International will be disrupted until the end of the day, Southeastern has confirmed. Welcome to our live blog We'll be bringing you all the latest updates relating to this incident

author: @annapolispatch
title: The Unsung Hero of the Backyard: Unveiling the Secrets of the Song Sparrow | Annapolis Patch
text: The Unsung Hero of the Backyard: Unveiling the Secrets of the Song Sparrow The Unsung Hero of the Backyard: Unveiling the Secrets of the Song Sparrow While brightly colored birds often steal the spotlight, the unassuming song sparrow holds its own, quietly captivating hearts with its melodious tunes and resilient spirit. Often overlooked amidst flashier neighbors, this small, brown bird embodies the very essence of adaptability and perseverance, weaving a captivating story in the heart of our backyards. Let's delve into the life of the song sparrow and discover the secrets it holds. Unlike their vibrantly plumaged counterparts, song sparrows choose subtlety. Their brown and gray feathers, accented with streaks and spots, offer exceptional camouflage amidst leaves and twigs. This seemingly plain outfit isn't a lack of fashion sense; it's a survival strategy, allowing them to blend seamlessly into their environment and evade predators. This is our most common sparrowmuch of the year. Look closely in the nearest shrubs and you'll get lucky before long.

author: Emily McGowan
title: Curious Elixirs—A Perfect Fit For Sober Celebrations?
text:
Curious Elixirs—A Perfect Fit For Sober Celebrations?
This review is not sponsored and contains the author’s personal experience. The author personally purchased this product. The Good Trade editors endorse products we’ve personally researched, tested, and genuinely love. Learn more about our methodology and business model here.
Almost everyone I know is rethinking their relationship to alcohol these days. After our lives were upended in 2020, many of us have settled into new drinking routines that, frankly, can be hard to escape. When I finally caved and downloaded TikTok a few months ago, I was met with even more people who were sober curious. I decided it was time to find an alternative happy hour drink for unwinding after work.
“I decided it was time to find an alternative happy hour drink for unwinding after work.”
I’ve known about Curious Elixirs for a few years, ever since the rise of the sober curious lifestyle. The brand was founded in 2015—before I even heard the term “sober curious”—and is on a mission to make the best booze-free cocktails. Curious Elixirs believes these alcohol-free drinks should be “unusually delicious, well-crafted, and good for bodies and souls.” That’s why the ingredients include adaptogens and aphrodisiacs mixed in with other organic ingredients by world-class bartenders and herbalists. (If you’re new to adaptogens, they are nontoxic, body-balancing ingredients that help you cope with physical and mental stress. Yes, please!)
It always sounded a little too good to be true, and I’d often return to the brand’s website with one burning question: would they really taste and feel like a suitable alternative to my favorite happy hour bevvies?
“Would they really taste and feel like a suitable alternative to my favorite happy hour bevvies?”
I decided to go all-in with the 24-drink variety pack, as my partner and I wanted a new beverage in our rotations. When it arrived, I was initially dismayed that the drinks actually came in 12 standard-sized cans and bottles—I thought it couldn’t possibly be nearly enough. But as we started pouring, it was very reasonable to split a can or bottle, especially when you poured it over ice (hence why a 12-pack of bottles is touted as a 24-drink pack). Each bottle comes with a tip on how best to garnish the cocktail, which is way fancier than I can keep up with! But I do keep more lemons on hand nowadays.
The flavors in the variety pack rotate each month based on supply chain availability. Here are the possible flavors you can get, alongside the functions some of their key ingredients have:
- Curious Elixir No. 1 is a
Pomegranate Negronithat contains rhodiola as a mood booster and pick-me-up. - Curious Elixir No. 2 is a
Spicy Marg Meets A Dark & Stormythat contains damiana, a Mayan aphrodisiac. - Curious Elixir No. 3 is a
Cucumber Collinsthat contains ashwagandha to support mood and memory. - Curious Elixir No. 4 is a
Sicilian Spritzthat contains rhubarb root for stress relief. - Curious Elixir No. 5 is a
Smoked Cherry Chocolate Old Fashionedthat contains shatavari, a body-balancing Ayurvedic aphrodisiac. - Curious Elixir No. 6 is a
Coconut Oatmilk Painkillerthat contains lemon balm and nutmeg for mood boosting and stress relief. - Curious Elixir No. 7 is a
Champagne Cocktailthat contains Chardonnay grapes, and green tea as a pick-me-up and lavender as a mood booster.
I’ve been subscribed for a few months and have tried every flavor. So far, my favorites have been numbers two and five. Curious Elixir No. 2 is a tasty margarita alternative, and the ginger and ancho chili makes for an extremely flavorful sip—perfect for drinking on the front porch. Curious Elixir No. 5, a smoked cherry chocolate old fashioned, is ideal if your mood is more “sitting in a housecoat in a large old library while a fire crackles nearby.” The ingredients include oak and chicory, and cacao and elderberry.
I will say I didn’t love No. 6, the Coconut Oatmilk Painkiller. I added ice, which I think was a bad move for me personally since watered-down plant-based milk is…just yuck. (No oat milk iced coffees for me!) Although, to be fair, the brand suggests that you can drink the cocktail neat, which I’ll try next time.
“I found myself with a little bit left at the end of the evening and didn’t feel the need to rush through it.”
The first night I tried one (a Cucumber Collins), I sipped on it throughout the evening without wanting to chug the whole thing, which I was worried about since these cocktails can be a bit pricey—the best deal is the monthly cocktail club at $89 for 24 servings.
I found myself with a little bit left at the end of the evening and didn’t feel the need to rush through it. I did tap the brakes for a second since it tasted like a cocktail, and I didn’t want to chug an alcoholic cocktail right before bed. But I reminded myself this was, in fact, the herbs and adaptogens and enjoyed the last bit of it without worrying I’d be groggy in the morning. (The ingredients for this particular cocktail include juniper, ashwagandha, orange blossom, lemon verbena, and angelica).
“And that’s the beauty of these babies—they don’t make me feel icky the next morning.”
And that’s the beauty of these babies—they don’t make me feel icky the next morning. The cocktails are satisfying enough for one a night. While no refined sugars are included in these cocktails, they can get a little sweet thanks to the fruit juices and, in the case of No. 5, the touch of coconut sugar. But that’s why nearly every cocktail is better poured over ice!
I’ve come to see my Curious Elixirs moment as a special occasion to mark my day; I sit out on the patio, and people watch the pedestrians and drivers during their hectic evening commute. I fix myself a glass as beautifully as I can (although I rarely have the “orange twist” garnish) and feel calm and scholarly as I imbibe. My partner joins me regularly and tells everyone about the elixirs; I think he might even like them more than I do.
“Treat it as a self-care moment, whip out your best cocktail glasses and pay close attention to the flavors and to the way the herbs and adaptogens make you feel.”
I do miss the “third place” of my neighborhood brewery, though, and I will admit I still pop out for a brew once a week. (Hey, it’s sober curious for now.)
My biggest recommendation in all this, if you’re hoping to replace a boozy habit, is to make the event actually something special. Treat it as a self-care moment, whip out your best cocktail glasses and pay close attention to the flavors and to the way the herbs and adaptogens make you feel. For me, these cocktails are a wonderful mindfulness tool that I can enjoy slowly and let the swirl of my day come to an end. (Honestly, these would make such a lovely gift and I might bring them along for a housewarming someday.)
“Whether you’re quitting drinking cold turkey, or just exploring another option for weekdays, go easy on yourself.”
While I haven’t fully replaced my favorite Hazy IPAs with Curious Elixirs, I can certainly envision a day where I’ve built even more booze-free habits in my life. And, for those who might wonder, all but No. 3 are safe for drinking during pregnancy, although you should consult your doctor about all of them just in case.
Whether you’re quitting drinking cold turkey, or just exploring another option for weekdays, go easy on yourself. The biggest thing is to examine what self-care means to you, and for me, it doesn’t include craft beer as much as it once did. And Curious Elixirs is a lovely, proactive alternative that never makes me feel headachey—or hungover. And I’ll say cheers to that!
Key Takeaways:
- While
Curious Elixirsare more expensive than a 12-pack of beer, you won’t find yourself reaching for one more impulsively and can easily share each bottle with someone (or spin around for seconds, why not!?). - The adaptogens are calming and gave me a slight buzzy, relaxed feeling.
- The texture of the drinks does have a little sparkle to it, which is nice if you’re swapping out a favorite cocktail! I highly recommend following the garnish recommendations on the bottle.
- Some of the drinks can be a little “thick” thanks to the organic fruit juices, but nothing a good ice cube can’t fix!
Emily McGowan is the Editorial Director at The Good Trade. She studied Creative Writing and Business at Indiana University, and has over ten years of experience as a writer and editor in sustainability and lifestyle spaces. Since 2017, she’s been discovering and reviewing the top sustainable home, fashion, beauty, and wellness products so readers can make their most informed decisions. Her editorial work has been recognized by major publications like The New York Times and BBC Worklife. You can usually find her in her colorful Los Angeles apartment journaling, caring for her rabbits and cat, or gaming. Say hi on Instagram!

author: Michael Katz
title: Idaho AG: State Will Prevail as High Court Punts on Abortion Law
text: By Michael Katz | Thursday, 27 June 2024 07:12 PM EDT Republican Idaho Attorney General Raul Labrador said Thursday he is confident about the legal fight ahead after the U.S. Supreme Court declined to rule on the merits of a case challenging the Gem State's abortion restrictions. The unsigned order from the justices in the case of Moyle v. United States leaves in place a ruling by an Idaho federal judge that temporarily blocked the state from enforcing its abortion ban, which has exceptions only to save the life of the mother and in cases of rape or incest, to the extent that it conflicts with the Emergency Medical Treatment and Active Labor Act (EMTALA). That 1986 federal law requires emergency rooms in hospitals that receive Medicare to provide "necessary stabilizing treatment" to patients who arrive with an "emergency medical condition." The order came a day after a draft of the ruling reportedly was "mistakenly" published on the Supreme Court's website. The Biden administration sued Idaho in 2022, shortly after the Supreme Court overturned the federal right to an abortion, which triggered Idaho's restrictions to take effect. The administration argued that in certain rare and extreme emergencies, abortion could constitute a medically stabilizing treatment under EMTALA and that denying abortions in non-life-threatening medical emergencies violated federal law. Labrador told reporters following the Supreme Court's decision that he is confident the lower courts will dismiss the Biden administration's case. "I remain committed to protect unborn life and ensure women in Idaho receive necessary medical care, and I will continue my outreach to doctors and hospitals across Idaho to ensure that they understand what our law requires," Labrador said, according to the Washington Examiner. "We look forward to ending this administration's relentless overreach into Idahoans' right to protect and defend life." The decision to send the case back to the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals was supported by three conservative justices — Amy Coney Barrett, Brett Kavanaugh, and Chief Justice John Roberts — because of concessions made by the Biden administration that the mental health of the mother does not constitute a medical emergency, the Examiner reported. Labrador said because the three other Republican-appointed judges — Samuel Alito, Clarence Thomas, and Neil Gorsuch — agreed with his office's interpretation of EMTALA, he is confident the 9th Circuit will rule in Idaho's favor. "What is clear is that the majority of the Supreme Court understood that either the interpretation of the U.S. government was wrong, as the dissent said, or, as the three conservatives said in their move to go to the 9th Circuit, that the [federal government's] interpretation would have been severely limited by their concessions," Labrador said, according to the Examiner. "So we feel pretty strongly that we're going to win this case in the end." Michael Katz is a Newsmax reporter with more than 30 years of experience reporting and editing on news, culture, and politics. © 2024 Newsmax. All rights reserved. author: feedloaderapi
title: Bassitt says everyone to blame as Jays’ shoddy season worsens with 13-0 loss to Rays
text:
TORONTO – Chris Bassitt declared everyone in the Toronto Blue Jays organization should bear the blame for its shoddy season.
Bassitt (8-9) made his remarks after the Tampa Bay Rays (52-51) throttled the Blue Jays (46-56) 13-0 with 16 hits in the rubber match of their three-game series on Thursday.
“I would say there’s not a single person in probably the whole organization who’s not disappointed right now,” Bassitt said.
Tampa Bay Rays pitcher Taj Bradley (45) throws during first inning American League MLB baseball action against the Toronto Blue Jays in Toronto on Thursday, July 25, 2024. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Chris Young “It just sucks. I don’t think anyone thought this is what was going to happen.
“I don’t think there’s one person with clean hands right now. I really don’t think we’ve done anything well this year. Well, maybe (Daulton) Varsho’s defence.
“Besides Varsho’s defence, I don’t see how anyone can say ‘I’ve done what I should.'”
Bassitt also remarked that the embarrassing loss was because the team has been fighting “demons.”
What did he mean?
“Everything that’s been going on,” Bassitt said.
“It’s whatever it might be, giving up that many hits, not being able to hit and the trade deadline. Who’s going to be here, who’s not going to be here? There’s a million different things right now that are just not great.”
With the trade deadline five days away, and the Blue Jays not meeting expectations of contending, the assumptions have been general manager Ross Atkins will sell off a handful of veteran players in exchange for prospects.
“You have ideas of who’s not going to be around much longer and a lot of these people mean a lot to you so yeah, it’s not fun,” Bassitt said.
Bassitt admitted he wasn’t sharp before 41,148 at Rogers Centre. He departed after five innings down 3-0 after tossing 97 pitches, giving up five hits and a walk with six strikeouts.
But then reliever Trevor Richards entered and was worse. He only faced seven hitters, giving up four runs on four hits and two walks.
“He’s been really good for us, especially earlier in the year,” Blue Jays manager John Scheider said of Richards. “But he doesn’t have a good feel for his change-up right now.
“When you have two pitches you have to be good with them. He doesn’t have his command right now and he’s falling behind (in the count).”
Tampa followed its four-run sixth inning by tacking on five more in the seventh.
Ernie Clement and his knuckleball had to be summoned from his third-base position to pitch the ninth and save the bullpen from further depletion. He gave up a run as the Rays pushed their hit total to 16.
Tampa Bay Rays designated hitter Brandon Lowe hits an RBI double off Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Chris Bassitt during third inning American League MLB baseball action in Toronto on Thursday, July 25, 2024. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Chris Young Taj Bradley (6-4) pitched six shutout innings and allowed only two hits, winning his third straight start.
The 23-year-old Bradley surrendered a one-out double to left from Spencer Horwitz and an infield hit to Vladimir Guerrero Jr. in the first inning.
But then the Rays righty settled down to retire 11 in a row and 17 of his final 18, allowing only a walk to Danny Jansen in the fifth. Bradley finished with seven strikeouts and a walk.
Brandon Lowe, Isaac Paredes, Alex Jackson and Amed Rosario were the big offensive producers in the series finale before 41,148 at Rogers Centre.
Lowe sent a 414-foot homer into the fifth deck down the right-field line to open the scoring. He knocked in two more runs with four hits and also twice walked.
Paredes drove in four runs with two hits, while Jackson checked in with three RBI with two hits. Rosario pounded a double and two singles.
ON THE MEND
Winnipeg Free Press | Newsletter Business Weekly Monday mornings
The latest local business news and a lookahead to the coming week.
Sign up for Business Weekly Sign Up I agree to the Terms and Conditions, Cookie and Privacy Policies , and CASL agreement . Blue Jays utility infielder Isiah Kiner-Falefa (sprained left knee) could begin a rehab assignment with Triple-A Buffalo on Saturday, provided there are no setbacks, according to Schneider.
Kiner-Falefa has been out since July 1 and has enjoyed a solid season with a .292 average and .338 on-base percentage.
ON DECK
The Blue Jays begin a three-game set against the Texas Rangers on Friday to conclude their nine-outing, 10-day homestand. Toronto’s Yusei Kikuchi (4-9) will open the series against lefty Andrew Heaney (4-10).
This report by The Canadian Press was first published July 25, 2024.

author: Reiner
title: #63 Un atentado islamista durante la misa de Navidad deja más de 160 cristianos asesinados en Nigeria
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#0](c0#c-0) Ese titular es tendencioso y confuso, y probablemente seas consciente. El ataque no fue durante una misa, como quiere dar a entender, si no que se atacó una serie de aldeas de manera coordinada. Y además, el factor religioso no es el único relevante, y tampoco está plenamente confirmado.
Hay fuentes mucho más serias, informadas y rigurosas que la que has mandado...
[#10](c10#c-10) Resulta difícil creer que puedan existir fuentes más serias leyendo maravillas cosas como:
La reciente matanza sucedida en Navidad confirma lo que anuncian las estadísticas: el cristianismo es la religión más perseguida en el mundo. Y no se limita solamente a esta región de África, sino que ocurre en Asia y Medio Oriente. Hace poco a cristianos perseguidos por el régimen comunista chino se les negó asilo en la España de Pedro Sánchez y el PSOE. Solo una lo pudo obtener porque su salud le impedía subir al avión donde la deportaban.
Todo ello, mientras las pateras siguen llegando a España, posiblemente con insurgentes tan radicales como los que masacran a los cristianos en Nigeria y sin el amparo para los cristianos que huyen de estos.
Mira, igual en que en Gaza, pero estos no lo llaman masacre.

Es como si dentro de un mes encontramos todos los medios diciendo que Aznar ha sido el peor presidente, que hipotecó a España para décadas. Sería inquietante, llevan décadas lavándole la cara a Aznar y que cambien de rumbo significaría que algo ha pasado o que está habiendo algún cambio de poderes de influencia.
[#9](c9#c-9) bueno. Entérate quién financio al valeroso pueblo de Afganistán y sus valerosos guerreros los muyahidines( les dedicaron Rambo iii y todo), o quien armó y financio a Irak, a estos que ves ahora este terrible atentado de la noticia, quien los organizo y financió, ... Después nos vuelves a contar estás cosas. Y si sigues pensando que está irán detrás de todo pq es omnipresente vale. Si ves q algún otro estado puede estar implicado, fijate quién lo arma y financia. Un saludo.
[#13](c13#c-13) lo se y lo he criticado 100 millones de veces, dinero de EEUU y Arabia Saudita y Pakistán.
Pero eso no les importa para llamarlos partisanos, "que en Europa les habría llamado partisanos y que habrían luchado contra los nazis"
Eso es mierda, el fanatismo religioso no atiende a razones.
Al menos tu comentario muestra algo de vergüenza de esa gente... Algo es algo.
[#20](c20#c-20) pues mira otra vez la captura que mandas, pq es exactamente lo que estoy diciendo. Afganistán era un país más adelantado que España y las mujeres iban sin velo. El tío Sam puso a la derecha religiosa conservadora, o lo que viene a ser los fascistas de toda la vida, pero en musulmán, a levantarse en armas... Cómo en Irak, libia, Egipto, Ucrania... Mismo proceder en todos lados, mismo resultado en todos lados. Países de mierda con gobiernos autoritarios y la población paupérrima y reprimida. Eso es el tío Sam.

https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guerra_de_Afganist%C3%A1n_(1978-1992)
Tienes una vision de la historia bastante distorsionada. China tambien dio armas a los talibanes para luchar contra la URSS, entre otros tantos paises....

[#31](c31#c-31) entérate lo que era Afganistán antes del 92.
Era un estado laico. En el año 90 la mayoría del profesorado eran mujeres, por ejemplo, que estaba integrada en el mundo laboral.
Y la revolución hostigada por el tío Sam puso a los integristas islámicos. Los valerosos muyahidines, como dijeron en Rambo 3, que les dedicaron.
Infórmate tú un poquito, antes de hablar sin saber.

Segundo:
Lo de que Afghanistan era laico , mujeres sin velo etc . se ha mostrado erróneo, solo era en Khabul . En las zonas agrarias (el resto del país) era anticuado respecto a esto .
Pero es un lío y al final no sabes lo que es verdad o no , internet está lleno de información contradictoria .

Aunque es posible que esa respuesta no tenga nada que ver con su comentario y simplemente sea una patética y lamentable pataleta porque no te ha gustado su respuesta.
[#17](c17#c-17) "por no sé que historia".
¿O por "no quiero saber"? Te dan la oportunidad de aprender, no la desperdicies.

Es una noticia de 160 muertos a manos de yihadistas por ser infieles.
Entre tu y yo? Es duro entrar aquí a un noticia tan trágica y ponerte a discutir sobre si la culpa es o no es de occidente o ya estás curado de eso?

1* las atrocidades de grupos islamistas radicales, no como tantos aquí que aprendieron que eran los talibanes hace 2 meses y ahora los llaman partisanos. Asesinos es su nombre, como es el del gobierno de irán o Arabia Saudita ente otros.
2* crítico a los que claramente ocultan y defienden a estos asesinos bajo un pretexto de victimismo en Palestina.
Un terrorista es un terrorista y lo es con 0 muertos en Palestina y con un millón de muertos.
